meanings.definition: The act of embarking on a journey or voyage.
meanings.sent1: The embarkations of the explorers were filled with excitement and anticipation.
meanings.sent2: The embarkations of the passengers onto the cruise ship were smooth and organized.
meanings.sent3: The embarkations of the teddy bears onto the toy boat caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The embarkations of dreams onto the canvas of reality can lead to beautiful adventures.
meanings.sent5: The embarkations of the tiny ants onto the leaf were like a miniature expedition.

meanings.definition: The process of loading passengers or goods onto a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The embarkations of luggage onto the plane were handled efficiently by the airport staff.
meanings.sent2: The embarkations of supplies onto the cargo ship took several hours to complete.
meanings.sent3: The embarkations of clowns onto the circus plane made for a colorful spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The embarkations of memories onto the vessel of the mind can be a nostalgic journey.
meanings.sent5: The embarkations of laughter onto the ship of friendship echoed across the waves.
